subtitles.text: Originally, it was nighttime and idle.
Today, it's "gobo" and "idol.
I am Hisanori Yoshida, announcer of the Japan Broadcasting Corporation (NHK), and my name is Gobo.
This all started when Reni-chan Takagi first saw me and called me "gobo".
Personally, I am an announcer for Japan Broadcasting Corporation.
I used to wait for idols at NHK when I was in high school.
I've been an idol fan for almost 30 years now.
I've been an idol fan for almost 30 years now.
This may be one of the reasons why Stardust's idols and Japan Broadcasting System are getting closer these days.
I've been working with them on various projects, and the other day we held the Stapla Fest at the Yokohama Arena.
We had one representative from each group to participate in the festival, and we had a variety of competitions.
We had one representative from each group to compete in various events, such as kendama, dance, etc.
I called it "Geisha Fest" as a back theme, and each group had a number of people.
And each group had a number of members, and there were 10 competitions for people with nine wives or so.
So, I guess they all participate in one event or another.
Among them, there was one who showed great performance this time.
Kana Harimakana.
Yes, this one or that one?
I'm Kana Harima.
I wonder if it was too hard for you to do it.
I was wondering if it's okay to do it...
I thought, "No, what's the problem now?" "Even if I can't do it, I'll do it.
I'll do it.
You've never failed to get a result, have you? No.
That's right. I thought I'd give it a shot, so I did.
I had more than 40 idols on StarPlaza the other day.
Yes, more than 52 people, yes, a great number, and the one who stood out the most was Harima, thank you very much.
When this competition was announced, everyone was talking about it. I wonder what Halima will do.
That's right.
What did you think when you heard about this project, Mr. Harima?
Ah...
First of all, you said you were going to sing in a group competition.
I'm the only one, so what's going to happen? I wondered if I would be able to participate in the competition, since it would be so personal.
So I wondered if I would be able to get out.
I'm not a member of the cheerleading squad, but I tend to be treated that way. I wondered if I would be treated that way.
But this time, I was allowed to participate in the 10-lap event even though I was alone.
At first, I was quite happy to be allowed to participate.
Basically, you like to participate, don't you? I love it.
I'm not the type of person who is a mainstay at athletic events.
At the normal school level? I'm talking about the school level.
I can't even be a part of the relay.
I was the type of person who would stand alone in a large group of competitors and be happy.
I think I understand a little bit of what you're talking about.
Is that possible?
When it came time to play dodgeball with the class...
Then, you're on your own, and everyone else is on theirs, right? You don't do that, do you?
No.
What exactly did you have in mind now?
You know, a quarantine machine.
A quarantine machine?
Yes, there is.
Well, not necessarily.
It's the type of event where you only go out with a large group of people, like a quarantine machine.
It's the kind of event where you have one group and two groups.
When we do it with one group versus two groups...
What about you, Mr. Harima?
He was the type to participate in events where everyone participates together.
I was never the type to stand out.
I see. In relay races, when there are only four people in a class...
You were never chosen as a relay runner, were you?
Well, I was never chosen.
So I've never been in a situation where I had to cheer for everyone.
I've never participated in anything like that.
But this time, I was able to participate in all the events at the athletic meet.
I'm not a great all-rounder, but
I'm not a great all-rounder, but if you think of it in terms of athletic events
Decathlete

Decalon?
Decalon.

Decathlon?
Decathlon.
I don't know.

In the games?

I love it.
I love it.
